title: I'm a Fashion Editor and Can't Get Over These 30 Cool Nordstrom Finds
excerpt: These are the best fashion shopping finds from Nordstrom to add to your 2025 wardrobe.
text: With 2025 in full swing and a fresh year ahead, I've been thinking a lot about how I want to update my closet. Interested to see the latest shopping arrivals of the year, I headed to Nordstrom to see the newest additions to the fashion selection online. While thousands of pieces are sitting in the new arrivals, I narrowed it down to my top buys.Winter layers and shoes are on the menu, from elevated quilted puffer jackets to shearling-lined snow boots to cashmere knits. Accessories are also a key focus, including Bottega's reissued 1980 woven leather clutch, Khaite's snakeskin embossed pouch, and Toteme's belted shoulder bag finished in canvas. I'm always freshening up my core staples as well, so have my eye on pieces that feel primed for 2025. Ahead, see the top pieces I would recommend shopping from Nordstrom for the year ahead. Almina Concept V Neck Cardigan The editor-favorite cardigan from Almina Concept that is almost always sold out. Madewell The '90s Straight Leg Jeans A great pair of straight-leg jeans that I want in every wash. TOTEME Double Face Wool Cocoon Coat Madewell The Essential Leather Belt Saint Laurent Le Loafer Monogram Penny Loafer Sleek penny loafers are replacing chunkier styles. Nordstrom Cable Crew Socks Lauren Ralph Lauren Faux Shearling Coat Currently into all things suede. Bottega Veneta The Lauren 1980 Intrecciato Leather Clutch Fp Movement Pippa Packable Puffer Jacket A winter workout favorite. Varley Davidson Woven Sweatshirt Everyone I know is adding Varley to their workout wardrobe. Nike Zenvy Dri-Fit High Waist Leggings An essential for Pilates sessions. The New Balance 530 sneakers used to be impossible to track down but now they're available on Nordstrom. TOTEME Oversize Quilted Jacket A modern classic from Toteme that is primed for winter. Vince Percie Genuine Shearling Bootie I've been on the hunt for great snow boots and finally found them. Almina Concept Oversized Wool/cash Sweater Another gorgeous knit from Almina Concept I'm eyeing. Madewell Pintuck Slim Pull-On Pants Exactly what I've been looking to wear for airplane travel. Reformation Valene Sleeveless Fit & Flare Dress The shoe shape every NYC fashion person is wearing. Khaite Medium Lina Snakeskin Embossed Leather Crossbody Bag A bag that can take you from day to night. Polo Ralph Lauren Pony Logo Short Pajamas Fresh pajamas for the new year. Polo Ralph Lauren Julianna Cable Stitch Wool & Cashmere Sweater To tie around the shoulders. Khaite The Danielle High Waist Straight Leg Jeans The Khaite Danielle jeans deserve all of the hype. Khaite Marfa Classic Flat Bootie Vince Wool & Cashmere Blend Crewneck Sweater This Vince knit comes in five different colors. TOTEME Twinflower Pleated Wool & Silk Midi Skirt A beautiful take on an A-line skirt. Wolford Individual 10 Pantyhose The ultimate semi-sheer tights for winter looks. Nordstrom Merino Wool Cardigan Lafayette 148 New York Camel Hair Midi Pencil Skirt Reformation Nancy Knee High Boot I'm eyeing these Reformation riding boots. TOTEME Belted Cotton & Linen Blend Canvas Bucket Bag Belted bags are on the rise. Kristen Nichols is the Associate Director, Special Projects at Who What Wear with over a decade of experience in fashion, editorial, and publishing. She oversees luxury and runway content as well as wedding features, and covers fashion within the luxury market, runway reporting, shopping features, trends, and interviews with leading industry experts. She also contributes to podcast recordings, social media, and branded content initiatives. Kristen has worked with brands including Prada, Chanel, Tiffany & Co., and MyTheresa, and rising designers such as Refine and Tove, and her style has been featured in publications including Vogue.com, Vogue France, WWD, and the CFDA. Before Who What Wear, Kristen began her career at Rodarte, where she worked on styling, photo shoots, and runway shows, and at Allure, where she moved into print and digital editorial. She graduated from the University of Southern California, where she studied art history and business, and currently lives in New York.
html:
With 2025 in full swing and a fresh year ahead, I've been thinking a lot about how I want to update my closet. Interested to see the latest shopping arrivals of the year, I headed to Nordstrom to see the newest additions to the fashion selection online. While thousands of pieces are sitting in the new arrivals, I narrowed it down to my top buys.

Winter layers and shoes are on the menu, from elevated quilted puffer jackets to shearling-lined snow boots to cashmere knits. Accessories are also a key focus, including Bottega's reissued 1980 woven leather clutch, Khaite's snakeskin embossed pouch, and Toteme's belted shoulder bag finished in canvas. I'm always freshening up my core staples as well, so have my eye on pieces that feel primed for 2025. Ahead, see the top pieces I would recommend shopping from Nordstrom for the year ahead.

Almina Concept

V Neck Cardigan

The editor-favorite cardigan from Almina Concept that is almost always sold out.

Madewell

The '90s Straight Leg Jeans

A great pair of straight-leg jeans that I want in every wash.

TOTEME

Double Face Wool Cocoon Coat

Madewell

The Essential Leather Belt

Saint Laurent

Le Loafer Monogram Penny Loafer

Sleek penny loafers are replacing chunkier styles.

Nordstrom

Cable Crew Socks

Lauren Ralph Lauren

Faux Shearling Coat

Currently into all things suede.

Bottega Veneta

The Lauren 1980 Intrecciato Leather Clutch

Fp Movement

Pippa Packable Puffer Jacket

A winter workout favorite.

Varley

Davidson Woven Sweatshirt

Everyone I know is adding Varley to their workout wardrobe.

Nike

Zenvy Dri-Fit High Waist Leggings

An essential for Pilates sessions.

The New Balance 530 sneakers used to be impossible to track down but now they're available on Nordstrom.

TOTEME

Oversize Quilted Jacket

A modern classic from Toteme that is primed for winter.

Vince

Percie Genuine Shearling Bootie

I've been on the hunt for great snow boots and finally found them.

Almina Concept

Oversized Wool/cash Sweater

Another gorgeous knit from Almina Concept I'm eyeing.

Madewell

Pintuck Slim Pull-On Pants

Exactly what I've been looking to wear for airplane travel.

Reformation

Valene Sleeveless Fit & Flare Dress

The shoe shape every NYC fashion person is wearing.

Khaite

Medium Lina Snakeskin Embossed Leather Crossbody Bag

A bag that can take you from day to night.

Polo Ralph Lauren

Pony Logo Short Pajamas

Fresh pajamas for the new year.

Polo Ralph Lauren

Julianna Cable Stitch Wool & Cashmere Sweater

To tie around the shoulders.

Khaite

The Danielle High Waist Straight Leg Jeans

The Khaite Danielle jeans deserve all of the hype.

Khaite

Marfa Classic Flat Bootie

Vince

Wool & Cashmere Blend Crewneck Sweater

This Vince knit comes in five different colors.

TOTEME

Twinflower Pleated Wool & Silk Midi Skirt

A beautiful take on an A-line skirt.

Wolford

Individual 10 Pantyhose

The ultimate semi-sheer tights for winter looks.

Nordstrom

Merino Wool Cardigan

Lafayette 148 New York

Camel Hair Midi Pencil Skirt

Reformation

Nancy Knee High Boot

I'm eyeing these Reformation riding boots.

TOTEME

Belted Cotton & Linen Blend Canvas Bucket Bag

Belted bags are on the rise.

Kristen Nichols is the Associate Director, Special Projects at Who What Wear with over a decade of experience in fashion, editorial, and publishing. She oversees luxury and runway content as well as wedding features, and covers fashion within the luxury market, runway reporting, shopping features, trends, and interviews with leading industry experts. She also contributes to podcast recordings, social media, and branded content initiatives. Kristen has worked with brands including Prada, Chanel, Tiffany & Co., and MyTheresa, and rising designers such as Refine and Tove, and her style has been featured in publications including Vogue.com, Vogue France, WWD, and the CFDA. Before Who What Wear, Kristen began her career at Rodarte, where she worked on styling, photo shoots, and runway shows, and at Allure, where she moved into print and digital editorial. She graduated from the University of Southern California, where she studied art history and business, and currently lives in New York.
